sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Chemical Fume Hood for safe handling of chemicals and reaction setups.
sections.scope: Applicable to laboratory activities carried out in the Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Verify the hood certification and check that the exhaust fan is running.
Clear the work area of any unnecessary equipment or chemical bottles.
Set the sash to the indicated safe working height (typically 12-18 inches).
Ensure that the air flow monitor shows a green light or adequate velocity.
Setup the chemical apparatus at least 6 inches behind the sash line.
Do not block the rear exhaust slots with large equipment; use blocks to elevate them if needed.
Keep the sash as low as possible during hazardous operations.
In case of a spill, neutralize it immediately and inform the lab supervisor.
Allow the hood to run for 5-10 minutes after completing work to purge residual vapors.
Wipe down the interior surfaces with an appropriate cleaning solution.
Lower the sash completely when leaving the laboratory.
Record the usage and any issues found in the equipment logbook.
precautions: Never put your head inside the fume hood during operation.
Do not use the hood as a long-term storage cabinet for chemicals.
Avoid excessive cross-drafts from doors or vents near the hood.
Ensure electrical equipment used inside the hood is properly grounded.
Wear full PPE including eye protection, gloves, and lab coat.
